stadium.name: The South Pole Palisade
stadium.description: A crude, fortified playing field built from rough-hewn logs. It's less a stadium and more a stockade against the wilderness. The 'grass' is mostly frozen mud and straw.

stats.pregame_ritual: Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Turning their helmet around three times before putting it on.
Licking a whetstone.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds‚Äîpart arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.

Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.

preGame: Hello, hello, hello! Step right up, sports fans, to a frost-bitten, bone-chilling Tuesday night Trollball extravaganza! This is Nok the Corrupter, your favorite demon of the airwaves, coming to you live from The South Pole Palisade! Whoo-ee! If you like your grass frozen into lethal shards and your stadium walls made of rough-hewn logs, you are in the right place! We've got a humdinger of a matchup between the Wardens' own favorites, The Greenwatch, and the local bruisers, The South Pole Yetis! The air is crisp, the wolves are howling, and the scent of iron-rich blood is already wafting from the end zones! üèüÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è  Before the whistle, I caught a glimpse of some truly professional preparation! Madea Mensch of the Greenwatch is currently hopping toward the starting line with his bootlaces tied together‚Äînow that is what I call commitment to a ritual! Meanwhile, Salahi Bushey is busy anointing his forehead with morning dew, though at this temperature, I suspect it is just frozen slush! Over in the Yetis' dugout, Udela Dorkus is literally licking a whetstone! Ha-ha! That's the spirit! And folks, let‚Äôs not forget the best part‚Äîtonight is an OPEN BAR! The ale is flowing faster than a river in spring, and the players are already looking quite festive! üçª  The Greenwatch might have the backing of those high-and-mighty Wardens like Sir Randy‚Äîwho I‚Äôm sure is somewhere polishing his fancy bow‚Äîbut the Yetis have the home-field advantage of frozen mud! This is going to be a real corker of a contest where the only thing harder than the hits is the ice underfoot! Get your bets in, keep your eyes on the Trollball, and let‚Äôs get ready for some beautiful, beautiful carnage! It‚Äôs Tuesday Night Trollball! üèàüî•
postGame: Holy Mackerel, what a magnificent display of drunken debauchery and shattered shinbones! The Greenwatch have absolutely dismantled the South Pole Yetis with a final score of 6 to 1! If you like seeing 'heroes' stumble around in a stupor while getting their teeth rattled, this was the game for you! The Wardens should be proud, or perhaps embarrassed, but either way, the Greenwatch walked away with the win and most of the beer! üçªüèÜ  The action started early when Darin Berliner snagged the ball in center field, only for Rese Halpern to throw a pass so wild it looked like she was aiming for a bird! Sayers Erdda of the Yetis snagged the interception, proving that even a Yeti can catch if the ball is practically handed to them! But the violence truly began when Isborne Krause delivered a crushing tackle on Drona Jacklin, sending the Greenwatch player to the dirt with a satisfying crunch! That's what we call a South Pole welcome, folks! üßäüí•  But you can't keep a good demon-adjacent team down! After Nariko Javed worked some quick healing magic, Drona Jacklin hopped right back into the fray and fired a 2-point shot from the Home 2-Point line that sailed through the hoop like a phoenix! That goal triggered the first massive wave of drinking, and let me tell you, Goldenberg Rimola started looking a bit tipsy before the ball even hit the ground! The Greenwatch took an early lead and never looked back, leaving the Yetis wondering if the wolves outside the palisade were friendlier than the opposition! üéØüç∫  By the time we hit the second half, the open bar was taking a serious toll! Nobe Haukom, clearly feeling the liquid courage, drained another 2-point shot right from center field! At that point, the alcohol consumption hit critical levels. Jessy Debbie and Verne Methuselah were looking like they were trying to walk on stilts made of jelly! It was a beautiful sight, truly! If only Sir Randy could see his rangers now‚Äîthey‚Äôd likely mistake his fancy bow for a very large toothpick! üèπü•¥  The Yetis did manage one moment of glory when Hilaire Guevara, absolutely plastered, went on a drunken tear through the end zone! She didn't just score; she practically dunked the ball with the strength of a frustrated frost giant! That brought the score to 2-1 briefly, but the comeback was shorter than a pixie's shadow. The Greenwatch responded by turning the field into a literal meat grinder! Darin Berliner and Verne Methuselah began a systematic campaign of destruction, injuring Selima Si and Ajit Serge in rapid succession! ü¶æüò§  The carnage was so absolute that the referees almost had to call the game early because the Yetis were running out of conscious players! Every time Seiter Aida managed to patch someone up, like Sale Tocci, the Greenwatch would immediately send them back to the dirt! Madea Mensch was tackling people while stumbling around like a man who‚Äôd seen the bottom of ten mugs! It was a masterpiece of aggressive intoxication! Even Coussoule Bidle tried a drunken run, only to be leveled by Darin Berliner in a hit that I‚Äôm sure King Nezmear's werewolves heard from leagues away! üê∫üí•  I must say, seeing the Cedar Hill crowd's faces as their Yetis were systematically disassembled was worth the price of admission alone! Imra the Master of Elixirs might be good at making medicine, but she clearly didn't provide anything for a hangover of this magnitude! The Greenwatch players like Herriott Dhiren and Rese Halpern were handing out injuries like they were party favors, and the Yetis simply couldn't keep their feet under them! It was less of a sport and more of a demolition derby with more vomit! üß™ü§Æ  In the final moments, Drona Jacklin put the icing on the frozen cake with another 2-point shot, bringing the final tally to 6 for the Greenwatch! The Yetis were so far gone that Sale Tocci was seen drunkenly passing the ball to herself, which is a bold strategy that unfortunately doesn't count for points in this reality! The sheer level of intoxication was historical; I haven't seen this many 'heroes' horizontal since Lord Orzalon's last birthday bash in the Demon Prison! üéÇ‚õìÔ∏è  While my favorite Ebon Gate Corruptors weren't on the field today, I have to give credit where credit is due‚Äîthe Greenwatch played with a brutality that warms my cold, dark heart! They ignored the 'noble' path and chose the path of high-scoring violence and heavy drinking! They even made the South Pole Palisade look like a playground! Those poor Yetis are going to be feeling this in the morning, and not just in their bruised ribs! üè•ü©π  So, there you have it, folks! A 6-1 victory for the Greenwatch in a game that will be remembered more for the bar tab than the playbook! As the players are carried off the field‚Äîsome because they're injured, most because they can't stand up‚Äîwe bid you a fond farewell from the frozen frontier! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off and heading to the bar myself! Stay bloody, Osterra! üìªüñ§
